reviewText: The packaging is good but the film quality is terrible! If it was meant to be like an old-time Serial Series the series begins in the middle. Poor film quality makes the viewing rather difficult and no character set-up makes it even more difficult to follow the plot-line. Sadly, I can not recommend this to anyone, not even for the $7-8 dollars charged for the product.

ALPHA VIDEO is a provider of vintage programming that's often unavailable elsewhere. Alpha's prices are fair, but so is transfer quality of some of their offerings. None have undergone restoration, yet the relative obscurity of their titles and its reasonable cost make these a worthwhile purchase. . The comic strip TERRY AND THE PIRATES was brought to life in 1934 by Milt Caniff, who stayed with the syndicated franchise twelve years. "Terry..." continued until 1973 without Caniff (who'd gone on to create STEVE CANYON). "Terry and the Pirates" became a radio show in 1937, running eleven seasons. The TV program aired 18 episodes from June 26, 1953 to November 21, 1953. BASIC PLOT: USAAF Col. Terry Lee goes to the Far East in search of an inherited goldmine. While there, Lee hires on as a pilot for Air Cathay, a cargo and passenger transport run by the somewhat dishonest Chopstick Joe. Terry's co-pilot is Hotshot Charlie, and Burma is his blonde girlfriend. Lee's nemesis is the beautiful and mysterious Dragon Lady. REGULAR CAST MEMBERS: John Baer - Terry Lee William Tracy - Hotshot Charlie Gloria Saunders - Dragon Lady Jack Reitzen - Chopstick Joe Sandra Spence - Burma Guest stars in TERRY AND THE PIRATES, Vol. 1 include TV's Cochise (Michael Ansara of "Broken Arrow") and Lois Lane (Phyllis Coates from "The Adventures of Superman), plus a heavyweight boxer who once fought Joe Louis (Lou Nova). Episode numbers, titles and guest stars are listed below: (#7) Boxer's Rebellion - Carol Thurston/Weaver Levy/Lou Nova/John Harmon (#10) Chinese Legacy - Michael Ansara/Walter Ng/Leon Lontoc/Ralph Ahn/Clarence Lung (#9) Co-Pilots - Harold Dyrenforth/William Yip/Harold Fong (#4) Green God - Phyllis Coates/Pat Gleason/Ted Hecht/Kay Luke/Otto Waldis . TERRY AND THE PIRATES, Vol. 2 offers up four more examples of this classic 50's TV adventure show.

Based on the comic strip and the radio series, the adventures of former U.S. Air Force officer Terry Lee, who takes a job piloting for a shady airline in the Far East.  Contains 4 black & white episodes from 1952: "Macao Gold," "Co-Pilots," "Black Market in Death" and "Tea Hee."
